content: I am covering a new FHIRPath implementation with tests and in the official FHIRPath test suite there is a test which says 1.2 / 1.8 = 0.66666667. Using my implementation I am getting a couple of sixes more. Is there any expectation that = has some sort of built-in tolerance? The fhirpath.js implementation passes this one, but I have searched the specifications on any kind of tolerance rules and haven't found anything so far.
